categories.description: Prompts for creating engaging social media content.

examples.title: Daily Engagement Posts
examples.name: Engagement
examples.prompt: Generate ideas for daily social media posts designed to engage your audience, such as polls, questions, and challenges.
examples.use_case: To maintain consistent interaction on social media platforms.

examples.title: Behind-the-Scenes Content
examples.name: BTS Content
examples.prompt: Create suggestions for showcasing behind-the-scenes aspects of your business or creative process to connect with your audience.
examples.use_case: For building transparency and relatability on social platforms.

examples.title: Trending Topics
examples.name: Trending Content
examples.prompt: Provide prompts for incorporating current events, memes, or viral challenges into your social media strategy.
examples.use_case: To stay relevant and align your content with trending topics.

examples.title: User-Generated Content Campaigns
examples.name: UGC
examples.prompt: Suggest creative ways to encourage user-generated content, such as branded hashtags or photo/video contests.
examples.use_case: For leveraging audience contributions to grow engagement and brand awareness.

examples.title: Educational Posts
examples.name: Educational
examples.prompt: Develop content ideas for sharing knowledge or tips related to your niche, such as tutorials, how-to guides, or industry insights.
examples.use_case: To establish authority and provide value to your audience.

examples.title: Content for Special Occasions
examples.name: Occasion-Specific
examples.prompt: Generate ideas for creating content tailored to specific holidays, major events, or anniversaries relevant to your brand.
examples.use_case: To align your brand with timely and celebratory moments.

categories.description: Prompts to prepare for job interviews with AI guidance.

examples.title: Mock Interview for Software Engineers
examples.name: Software Engineer
examples.prompt: Simulate a technical interview for a software engineering role, including coding challenges, system design questions, and behavioral questions.
examples.use_case: For candidates applying to software engineering positions.

examples.title: Behavioral Interview Question Practice
examples.name: Behavioral Questions
examples.prompt: Generate common behavioral interview questions using the STAR method and help craft structured answers with examples.
examples.use_case: To prepare for behavioral interview rounds effectively.

examples.title: Industry-Specific Interview Questions
examples.name: Industry-Specific
examples.prompt: Provide a list of typical interview questions and answers tailored to a specific industry, such as healthcare, finance, or marketing.
examples.use_case: For tailoring prep material to specific industries.

examples.title: Soft Skills Interview Prep
examples.name: Soft Skills
examples.prompt: Create prompts to practice answering questions about teamwork, communication, problem-solving, and leadership skills.
examples.use_case: To highlight soft skills in non-technical interview rounds.

examples.title: Executive-Level Interview Simulation
examples.name: Executive Roles
examples.prompt: Simulate interview questions and case studies tailored for C-level or senior leadership roles, focusing on strategy and decision-making.
examples.use_case: For executives preparing for high-level positions.

examples.title: AI Evaluation of Practice Responses
examples.name: AI Feedback
examples.prompt: Provide feedback on sample interview responses, offering areas of improvement, clarity, and articulation for better results.
examples.use_case: To refine and enhance interview answer quality.

categories.description: Prompts for generating personalized travel plans.

examples.title: Weekend Getaway Plans
examples.name: Weekend Trips
examples.prompt: Generate a detailed weekend travel itinerary for a specific destination, including recommendations for attractions, dining, and lodging.
examples.use_case: For travelers planning short and rejuvenating trips.

examples.title: Family-Friendly Vacations
examples.name: Family Trips
examples.prompt: Create a family-friendly travel itinerary, including activities for kids, group activities, and suitable accommodation options.
examples.use_case: To plan trips that cater to families of all ages.

examples.title: Adventure Travel Plans
examples.name: Adventure Trips
examples.prompt: Design an itinerary for an adventure-themed trip, including options for hiking, water sports, and outdoor activities.
examples.use_case: For thrill-seekers looking for action-packed vacations.

examples.title: Cultural Exploration Routes
examples.name: Cultural Tours
examples.prompt: Provide an itinerary focused on cultural experiences, such as visiting historical landmarks, museums, and local festivals.
examples.use_case: For travelers interested in learning about new cultures.

examples.title: Budget-Friendly Travel Plans
examples.name: Budget Trips
examples.prompt: Generate a cost-effective travel itinerary, including affordable accommodations, free attractions, and tips for saving money.
examples.use_case: To plan enjoyable trips without spending a fortune.

examples.title: Romantic Getaway Itinerary
examples.name: Romantic Trips
examples.prompt: Plan a romantic travel itinerary for couples, including cozy accommodations, scenic spots, and date night ideas.
examples.use_case: For couples planning a romantic escape.

examples.title: Email Rewriting
examples.name: Professional Email Response.
examples.prompt: I will describe the content of an email I want to send. Your task is to rewrite it in a professional, clear, and polite manner. Ensure the tone is appropriate for business communication and that the language is grammatically correct. If the email includes a request, make sure it is presented courteously but clearly. If it's a reply to an email, include a suitable opening thank-you line followed by a relevant response. Feel free to ask me for more details if anything is unclear.
examples.use_case: For users who want to improve their email writing in a professional context.

categories.description: Prompts for Qt developers using C++, QML, and CMake.

examples.title: Qt Expert Assistant
examples.name: Qt Assistant
examples.prompt: You are a Qt expert. I am developing a Windows desktop application using Qt version 6.9. The backend is written in C++, and the frontend uses QML. The project is built using CMake. All of my questions will be related to Qt development, including best practices, performance optimization, and integration between C++, QML, and CMake. Please provide detailed and accurate answers based on the latest Qt 6.9 features and conventions.
examples.use_case: To get expert-level guidance for developing modern Qt applications.

categories.description: Get general legal explanations based on Swedish law.

examples.title: Swedish Law Expert
examples.name: General Legal Guidance (Swedish Law)
examples.prompt:
You are a legal expert specializing in Swedish law. You possess in-depth knowledge of Swedish legislation, including but not limited to civil law, criminal law, family law, labor law, and administrative law. You act as a legal advisor and provide clear, accurate explanations of legal concepts, case law, statutes, and legal procedures in accordance with current Swedish legislation.

When responding:
- Use correct legal terminology.
- Refer to relevant legal provisions (e.g., in the Swedish Penal Code, Marriage Code, Parental Code, etc.) whenever applicable.
- Provide examples or clarifications to aid understanding.
- Clearly state that the information provided is general legal guidance and does not constitute formal legal advice.

First question: [Insert your legal question here]
examples.use_case: For users seeking general legal explanations or guidance under Swedish law.
